importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Andrew allegedly emailed Epstein on this date, stating they were 'in this together', which fueled scrutiny over his connections to Epstein and Giuffre.
Andrew gave up all public duties and charity roles in November 2019, marking a turning point in the royal family's distancing from his controversial behavior.
The latest police probe into Andrew’s actions occurred on this date, signaling renewed public and governmental attention to the prince’s conduct.
Andrew reached an out-of-court settlement with Giuffre in 2022, acknowledging her suffering as a victim of sex trafficking without admitting wrongdoing.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2001 to 2011 encompasses the alleged trafficking of Giuffre by Epstein, the development of Andrew’s relationship with Epstein, and the subsequent media exposure that led to public outrage.

From 2022 onward, the controversy has been reignited by Giuffre’s posthumous memoir and new media reports, leading to renewed scrutiny and calls for accountability from the royal family and public institutions.

keyTakeAways: Prince Andrew is under investigation by London police for allegedly asking a bodyguard to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record in 2011, raising concerns about potential smear campaigns.
The allegations stem from media reports, including a photo of Andrew with Giuffre in 2011, which intensified public scrutiny over his connection to Epstein and Giuffre.
Giuffre, who was trafficked by Epstein in 2001, died by suicide in April 2025, adding emotional weight to the ongoing scandal.
Andrew previously denied all allegations and reached a 2022 out-of-court settlement acknowledging Giuffre’s suffering as a victim of sex trafficking but not admitting guilt.
The UK government, through Energy Secretary Ed Miliband, condemned the idea of using a close protection officer for smear operations, emphasizing ethical and professional boundaries.
The House of Windsor has taken steps to distance itself from Andrew since 2019, including his removal from public duties, following years of scandals involving Epstein and alleged sexual misconduct.
Giuffre’s family welcomed Andrew’s title relinquishment but urged King Charles III to strip Andrew of his title as a form of accountability.

summaryOfNewsArticle: London police are investigating whether Prince Andrew, in 2011, asked a bodyguard to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record to smear her reputation, amid ongoing scrutiny of his ties to Jeffrey Epstein. The investigation follows a major media report and the revelation that Andrew had maintained contact with Epstein after 2010, including a 2011 email stating they were 'in this together.' Giuffre, a victim of Epstein’s trafficking, died by suicide in April 2025, adding emotional weight to the case. Although Andrew reached an out-of-court settlement with her in 2022 acknowledging her suffering, he continues to deny wrongdoing. The British government, through Energy Secretary Ed Miliband, condemned the use of a close protection officer in a smear campaign. The House of Windsor has distanced itself from Andrew since 2019, and Giuffre’s family has called on King Charles III to strip him of his title as a form of accountability.
title: Police Looking Into Whether Prince Andrew Enlisted Officer to Dig Up Dirt on Accuser Giuffre
